parameters.definition: Capacity of a canoe to carry fish
Capacity of a diesel boat to carry fish
Minimum number of canoes for each diesel boat
Minimum number of fish to transport to shore

description: A large fishing boat sends fish back to shore either by small canoes or smaller diesel boats. A canoe can carry back \param{CanoeCapacity} fish while a small diesel boat can carry back \param{DieselBoatCapacity} fish. In order to follow environmental rules, the number of small canoes used has to be at least \param{CanoesPerDieselBoat} times as many as the number of diesel boats used. If at least \param{MinimumFishToTransport} fish need to be transported to shore, minimize the total number of canoes and diesel boats needed.
